com.getstream.sdk.chat.utils.exomedia

Class AudioPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.getstream.sdk.chat.utils.exomedia.AudioPlayer

  • public class AudioPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    An AudioPlayer that uses the ExoPlayer as the backing architecture. If the current device does NOT pass the Android Compatibility Test Suite (CTS) then the backing architecture will fall back to using the default Android MediaPlayer.

    To help with quick conversions from the Android MediaPlayer this class follows the APIs the Android MediaPlayer provides.

      • init

        protected void init(AudioPlayerApi audioPlayerImpl)

      • getAudioSessionId

        public int getAudioSessionId()
        Returns the audio session ID.
        Returns:
        the audio session ID. Note that the audio session ID is 0 only if a problem occurred when the AudioPlayer was constructed or the audio stream hasn't been instantiated.

      • setRepeatMode

        public void setRepeatMode(int repeatMode)
        Sets the repeat mode for this MediaPlayer. Note: This will only change the ExoPlayer implementation
        Parameters:
        repeatMode - The repeat mode to use

      • setPlaybackSpeed

        public boolean setPlaybackSpeed(float speed)
        Sets the playback speed for this MediaPlayer.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed to play the media back at
        Returns:
        True if the speed was set

      • getPlaybackSpeed

        public float getPlaybackSpeed()
        Retrieves the current speed the media is playing at.
        Returns:
        The current playback speed

      • setAudioStreamType

        public void setAudioStreamType(int streamType)
        Sets the audio stream type for this MediaPlayer. See AudioManager for a list of stream types. Must call this method before prepare() or prepareAsync() in order for the target stream type to become effective thereafter.
        Parameters:
        streamType - The audio stream type
        See Also:
        AudioManager

      • setDataSource

        public void setDataSource(android.net.Uri uri)
        Sets the source path for the audio item. This path can be a web address (e.g. http://) or an absolute local path (e.g. file://)
        Parameters:
        uri - The Uri representing the path to the audio item

      • setDataSource

        public void setDataSource(android.net.Uri uri,
                          MediaSource mediaSource)
        Sets the source path for the audio item. This path can be a web address (e.g. http://) or an absolute local path (e.g. file://)
        Parameters:
        uri - The Uri representing the path to the audio item
        mediaSource - The MediaSource to use for audio playback

      • setDrmCallback

        public void setDrmCallback(MediaDrmCallback drmCallback)
        Sets the MediaDrmCallback to use when handling DRM for media. This should be called before specifying the videos uri or path
        NOTE: DRM is only supported on API 18 +
        Parameters:
        drmCallback - The callback to use when handling DRM media

      • prepareAsync

        public void prepareAsync()
        Prepares the media specified with setDataSource(Uri) or setDataSource(Uri, MediaSource) in an asynchronous manner

      • getVolumeLeft

        public float getVolumeLeft()
        Retrieves the current left volume
        Returns:
        the volume for the left setChannel

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(float leftVolume,
                      float rightVolume)
        Sets the volume level for the audio playback.
        Parameters:
        leftVolume - The volume range [0.0 - 1.0]
        rightVolume - The volume range [0.0 - 1.0]

      • setWakeMode

        public void setWakeMode(android.content.Context context,
                        int mode)
        Set the low-level power management behavior for this AudioPlayer.

        This function has the AudioPlayer access the low-level power manager service to control the device's power usage while playing is occurring. The parameter is a combination of PowerManager wake flags. Use of this method requires Manifest.permission.WAKE_LOCK permission. By default, no attempt is made to keep the device awake during playback.

        Parameters:
        context - the Context to use
        mode - the power/wake mode to set
        See Also:
        PowerManager

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Stops the current audio playback and resets the listener states so that we receive the callbacks for events like onPrepared

      • seekTo

        public void seekTo(long milliSeconds)
        Moves the current audio progress to the specified location. This method should only be called after the AudioPlayer is prepared. (see setOnPreparedListener(OnPreparedListener)
        Parameters:
        milliSeconds - The time to move the playback to

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Returns if an audio item is currently in playback
        Returns:
        True if an audio item is playing

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the playback for the audio item specified in setDataSource(Uri). This should be called after the AudioPlayer is correctly prepared (see setOnPreparedListener(OnPreparedListener))

      • pause

        public void pause()
        If an audio item is currently in playback, it will be paused

      • stopPlayback

        public void stopPlayback()
        If an audio item is currently in playback then the playback will be stopped

      • release

        public void release()
        Releases the resources associated with this media player

      • getDuration

        public long getDuration()
        Retrieves the duration of the current audio item. This should only be called after the item is prepared (see setOnPreparedListener(OnPreparedListener)). If overrideDuration(long) is set then that value will be returned.
        Returns:
        The millisecond duration of the video

      • overrideDuration

        public void overrideDuration(long duration)
        Setting this will override the duration that the item may actually be. This method should only be used when the item doesn't return the correct duration such as with audio streams. This only overrides the current audio item.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration for the current media item or < 0 to disable

      • getCurrentPosition

        public long getCurrentPosition()
        Retrieves the current position of the audio playback. If an audio item is not currently in playback then the value will be 0. This should only be called after the item is prepared (see setOnPreparedListener(OnPreparedListener))
        Returns:
        The millisecond value for the current position

      • getBufferPercentage

        public int getBufferPercentage()
        Retrieves the current buffer percent of the audio item. If an audio item is not currently prepared or buffering the value will be 0. This should only be called after the audio item is prepared (see setOnPreparedListener(OnPreparedListener))
        Returns:
        The integer percent that is buffered [0, 100] inclusive

      • getWindowInfo

        public WindowInfo getWindowInfo()
        Retrieves the information associated with the current com.google.android.exoplayer2.Timeline.Window used by the ExoPlayer backed implementation. When the MediaPlayer backed implementation is being used this will be null.
        Returns:
        The current Window information or null

      • trackSelectionAvailable

        public boolean trackSelectionAvailable()
        Determines if the current video player implementation supports track selection for audio or video tracks.
        Returns:
        True if tracks can be manually specified

      • setTrack

        @Deprecated
public void setTrack(ExoMedia.RendererType trackType,
                                  int trackIndex)
        Deprecated. Use setTrack(ExoMedia.RendererType, int, int)
        Changes to the track with trackIndex for the specified trackType
        Parameters:
        trackType - The type for the track to switch to the selected index
        trackIndex - The index for the track to switch to

      • setTrack

        public void setTrack(ExoMedia.RendererType trackType,
                     int groupIndex,
                     int trackIndex)
        Changes to the track with trackIndex for the specified trackType
        Parameters:
        trackType - The type for the track to switch to the selected index
        groupIndex - The index for the group in the TrackGroupArray specified by the trackType
        trackIndex - The index for the track to switch to

      • getAvailableTracks

        public java.util.Map<ExoMedia.RendererType,TrackGroupArray> getAvailableTracks()
        Retrieves a list of available tracks to select from. Typically trackSelectionAvailable() should be called before this.
        Returns:
        A list of available tracks associated with each track type
